018package org.opengis.referencing.cs;
019
020import java.time.temporal.ChronoUnit;
021import org.opengis.util.CodeList;
022import org.opengis.annotation.UML;
023import org.opengis.geoapi.internal.Vocabulary;
024
025import static org.opengis.annotation.Obligation.CONDITIONAL;
026import static org.opengis.annotation.Specification.ISO_19111;
027
028
029/**
030 * Type (measure, integer or date) of coordinate values.
031 * Most axes implicitly use the {@link #MEASURE} type.
032 *
033 * @author  OGC Topic 2 (for abstract model and documentation)
034 * @author  Martin Desruisseaux (Geomatys)
035 * @version 3.1
036 *
037 * @see TimeCS#getCoordinateType()
038 *
039 * @since 3.1
040 */
041@Vocabulary(capacity=3)
042@UML(identifier="CoordinateDataType", specification=ISO_19111)
043public final class CoordinateDataType extends CodeList<CoordinateDataType> {
044    /**
045     * Serial number for compatibility with different versions.
046     */
047    private static final long serialVersionUID = -7295884834031271882L;
048
049    /**
050     * Quantity expressed as a count used for a temporal or ordinal coordinate system axis.
051     * The fractional values between integer values may have no meaning.
052     */
053    @UML(identifier="integer", obligation=CONDITIONAL, specification=ISO_19111)
054    public static final CoordinateDataType INTEGER = new CoordinateDataType("INTEGER");
055
056    /**
057     * Quantity expressed as a measure used for a temporal coordinate system axis.
058     * This is the usual type for coordinate system axes.
059     */
060    @UML(identifier="measure", obligation=CONDITIONAL, specification=ISO_19111)
061    public static final CoordinateDataType MEASURE = new CoordinateDataType("MEASURE");
062
063    /**
064     * Numbers related to dates or times expressed in the proleptic Gregorian calendar.
065     * This is used for a temporal coordinate system axis.
066     * The time elapsed between two consecutive coordinate values may vary.
067     *
068     * <h4>Examples</h4>
069     * <p>Coordinate values may be years expressed as a decimal year in the Gregorian calendar.
070     * For example, 2017-03-25 in the Gregorian calendar is epoch 2017.23.
071     * The number of days between two integer values may vary because of leap years.
072     * For a coordinate system using this convention, {@link TimeCS#getTemporalUnit()}
073     * should return {@link ChronoUnit#YEARS}.</p>
074     *
075     * <p>Coordinate values may be a count of months since a given year. For example, 1 = January 2000,
076     * 2 = February 2000, 3 = March 2000, …, 13 = January 2001, 14 = February 2001, <i>etc</i>.
077     * The number of days between two integer values may very because of different month lengths.
078     * For a coordinate system using this convention, {@link TimeCS#getTemporalUnit()}
079     * should return {@link ChronoUnit#MONTHS}.</p>
080     */
081    @UML(identifier="dateTime", obligation=CONDITIONAL, specification=ISO_19111)
082    public static final CoordinateDataType DATE_TIME = new CoordinateDataType("DATE_TIME");
083
084    /**
085     * Constructs an element of the given name.
086     *
087     * @param name  the name of the new element. This name shall not be in use by another element of this type.
088     */
089    private CoordinateDataType(final String name) {
090        super(name);
091    }
092
093    /**
094     * Returns the list of {@code CoordinateDataType}s.
095     *
096     * @return the list of codes declared in the current JVM.
097     */
098    public static CoordinateDataType[] values() {
099        return values(CoordinateDataType.class);
100    }
101
102    /**
103     * Returns the list of codes of the same kind as this code list element.
104     * Invoking this method is equivalent to invoking {@link #values()}, except that
105     * this method can be invoked on an instance of the parent {@code CodeList} class.
106     *
107     * @return all code {@linkplain #values() values} for this code list.
108     */
109    @Override
110    public CoordinateDataType[] family() {
111        return values();
112    }
113
114    /**
115     * Returns the coordinate data type that matches the given string, or returns a new one if none match it.
116     * This methods returns the first instance (in declaration order) for which the {@linkplain #name() name}
117     * is {@linkplain String#equalsIgnoreCase(String) equals, ignoring case}, to the given name.
118     * If no existing instance is found, then a new one is created for the given name.
119     *
120     * @param  code  the name of the code to fetch or to create.
121     * @return a code matching the given name.
122     */
123    public static CoordinateDataType valueOf(String code) {
124        return valueOf(CoordinateDataType.class, code, CoordinateDataType::new).get();
125    }
126}
